settings.text: An MAOI that is used to treat depression is called Nardil (phenelzine). It functions by preventing the breakdown of monoamines, which are neurotransmitters important for controlling mood. Although it has been demonstrated that Nardil is effective in treating depression, it also has a number of undesirable side effects, such as drowsiness, headaches, and dry mouth. If you are also taking an SSRI or another MAOI, you should avoid taking Nardil. Nardil should not be taken if you are pregnant or nursing. In order to better understand Nardil, this article is meant to provide information to Welzo users.

It has been demonstrated that nardil works well to treat depression. Patients in one study who took Nardil for eight weeks reported significantly fewer depressive symptoms than those who took a placebo. The medication Nardil is also effective in treating social anxiety. In one study, patients taking Nardil for 12 weeks experienced significantly fewer social anxiety symptoms than those taking a placebo. An additional condition that nardil may help with is post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Patients in one study who took Nardil for eight weeks experienced significantly less PTSD symptom reduction than those who took a placebo.

Several adverse reactions to nardil include drowsiness, headaches, and dry mouth. Nardil may also upset the stomach, resulting in nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Impotence and a decline in libido are other sexual side effects that Nardil may produce. If you are also taking an SSRI or another MAOI, you should avoid taking Nardil. Nardil should not be taken if you are pregnant or nursing.

Nardil is quickly absorbed from the digestive system and reaches its peak blood levels in two hours. The half-life of nardil is between four and six hours, and it is widely distributed throughout the body. Nardil is broken down in the liver and eliminated through the urine.

Nardil's starting dosage is typically 15 mg per day, divided into two doses. Until the desired response is obtained, the dose may be raised by 15 mg each week. The maximum daily dose of Nardil that is advised is 90 mg. It's best to take Nardil with food.

Several different medications and nardil may interact negatively. It is not advised to combine Nardil with any other MAOIs or SSRIs. Nardil may also interact with a variety of other drugs, such as epinephrine, tricyclic antidepressants, and antihistamines. Before taking Nardil, you should discuss any medications you are currently taking with your doctor.

settings.heading: Why should Nardil not be prescribed?

settings.text:
The human body contains small amounts of the trace mineral boron. Due to the lack of a known biological function for which the body needs it, it is not regarded as an essential nutrient.

The health of bones and cognitive function, however, may be influenced by boron, according to some studies. There isn't much scientific data to back up claims that boron supplements can treat these conditions, despite the marketing of these products.

In general, when consumed in the recommended doses, boron supplements are considered safe. However, these supplements should not be taken by those who are pregnant or have young children. The safety of boron supplements for these populations cannot be determined from the available scientific data.

Speak with your doctor first if you're thinking about taking a boron supplement.
